snippet: As the island of Giglio prepares to commemorate the anniversary of the wreck on Sunday, environmentalists worry that the longer the delay, the greater the environmental risk.
abstract: Salvage companies announce at news conference that wreck of luxury liner Costa Concordia, which ran aground off Tuscan coast in 2012, could be removed by end of summer, few months behind schedule.
lead_paragraph: As the island of Giglio prepares to commemorate the anniversary of the wreck on Sunday, environmentalists worry that the longer the delay, the greater the environmental risk.

headline.seo: Salvagers in Italy Say Costa Concordia Wreck May Be Gone by Summer’s End
headline.main: Salvagers in Italy Say Costa Concordia Wreck May Be Gone by Summer’s End
headline.print_headline: Salvagers in Italy Say Costa Concordia Wreck May Be Gone by Summer’s End
